index_struct.text: This code file is a GitHub workflow that automates the process of creating a package. It is triggered by a push to the main branch or a pull request and runs on either Ubuntu or Windows with Python 3.9. It installs the necessary dependencies, builds the package, uses it, and runs it. Finally, it imports the package to ensure it is working correctly. The purpose of this code is to create a package that can be used and tested without any additional installation. The code includes algorithms, data structures, functions, classes, and variables to build the package, use it, and test it. The workflow automates the process of creating a package, making it easier to use and test without any additional installation.

0.text:
name: Build Package

# Build package on its own without additional pip install

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]
        python-version: ["3.9"]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      - name: Install deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          python -m pip install wheel setuptools
          python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel

1.text:
python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
      - name: Use package
        run: |
          cd dist
          python -m pip install --find-links=. gpt-index
      - name: Run import
        run: |
          python -c "import gpt_index"

The workflow runs on either Ubuntu or Windows and uses Python 3.9. It installs the necessary dependencies, builds the package, and then uses and runs the package. Finally, it imports the package to ensure it is working correctly.

name: Build Package

# Build package on its own without additional pip install

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]
        python-version: ["3.9"]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      - name: Install deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          python -m pip install wheel setuptools
          python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
      - name: Use package
        run: |
          cd dist
          python -m pip install --find-links=. gpt-index
      - name: Run import
        run: |
          python -c "import gpt_index"
